definition: treat sth lightly/to lower one's guard

to fall/to drop/to lag behind/to lose/to go missing/to reduce/fall (in prices)/to lose (value, weight etc)/to wag/to swing/to turn/to change/to exchange/to swap/to show off/to shed (hair)/(used after certain verbs to express completion, fulfillment, removal etc)
to use/by means of/according to/in order to/because of/at (a certain date or place)
abbr. for Israel 以色列[Yi3 se4 lie4]

sentences.english: We must not take this issue lightly.
sentences.chinese: 对于物价，我们不敢掉以轻心。

sentences.english: Regular adulteress inspection, for all sorts of discomfort don't take it lightly.
sentences.chinese: 定期妇检，对于各种不适切莫掉以轻心。

sentences.english: But moving on should not mean turning inward or dropping its guard.
sentences.chinese: 但前进并不意味着固步自封或掉以轻心。

sentences.english: That’s exactly why their word isn’t taken lightly.
sentences.chinese: 这正是为什么对他们的话不可掉以轻心。

sentences.english: We were foolish and heedless, and you were right to break it off.
sentences.chinese: 我们很愚蠢，太掉以轻心了，结束那场游戏你是对的。

sentences.english: Still, I couldn’t take the primary for granted.
sentences.chinese: 尽管如此，我仍然不能对初选掉以轻心。

sentences.english: And this step should not be viewed lightly!
sentences.chinese: 而这个步骤切不可掉以轻心。

sentences.english: But we must never lose sight of what's at stake.
sentences.chinese: 但是在厉害攸关的时刻，我们绝不能掉以轻心。

sentences.english: Look attentively, and you will see as water in lake lightly rocks.
sentences.chinese: 聚精会神地看，你将看到水在湖岩掉以轻心。

sentences.english: The risks of deglobalisation, however, should not be lightly dismissed.
sentences.chinese: 不过，我们不应对去全球化的风险掉以轻心。

sentences.english: Advice from sidewalk superintendents, including owners, must be taken lightly.
sentences.chinese: 从人行道监督，包括业主咨询，必须采取掉以轻心。

sentences.english: Don't empty the baby out with the bath water.
sentences.chinese: 做事勿掉以轻心，把婴儿与洗澡水一起给倒了。

sentences.english: Investors shouldn't take too much comfort, however.
sentences.chinese: 但投资者不应太过掉以轻心。

sentences.english: A coffee shop did not dare to head to the shop decoration and landscaping lightly.
sentences.chinese: 没有一家咖啡店敢对店头装饰与美化工作掉以轻心。

sentences.english: One must not take such things lightly, thinking that they won't cause disturbances.
sentences.chinese: 不要以为这样搞就不会出乱子，可以掉以轻心。

definition: to belittle/to look down upon/to despise
to relax/to relax efforts/to slack off/to take it easy/complacent/undisciplined
to be on the alert/vigilant/alert/on guard/to warn
to guard against/to be vigilant/watch you don't (slip)/also pr. [ti2 fang2]
